intro: Lipochaeta connata subsp. acris, commonly known as the slender bluebells, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions.
